subject: Eli Wins One
event:
Nice win for the Giants and Eli Manning today.

I watched the game, and enjoyed the victory, but please forgive if I don't write one of my long football posts.  Our cat Augustus is very sick, and with that on the back of our minds, it's been hard for Parris and me to enjoy the NFL playoffs as we would ordinarily.

Test results on Gus are due back tomorrow to our vet, so please spare some good thoughts for him.  He's been a huge part of our lives for twelve years now.

As for football, it did help take our minds off our worries.  Some good games.  Congrats to all the teams that won, and to all the valiant losers.

comments.article: ...and plenty of them!! Thank you for all you do!!!!
comments.subject: Good thoughts coming your way...

comments.article:
Many good thoughts from Shadow and me for Gus. Let us know what the vet says. Give Parris a hug for me.

*Kathleen
comments.subject: Mr Handsome Fluffy Toes

comments.article: *good thoughts for Gus*
I went 4-0 in picks this week!  WHOO!

I'm so sorry about Gus. I hope the tests have some good news.

--Kris
best of wishes for Gus.  It's never easy when one of those we love is sick, fury or otherwise.
Your small and furry family member will be in my thoughts.
I scanned your comment too quickly, inadvertently omitting the word "family", and proceeded to spew the proverbial tea on the monitor!
Good thoughts and positive vibes for your dear Augustus.
I hope the tests come back with something easily remedied. We have a 12-year-old tabby, Trophy, who makes our house a home with his love and antics, so I understand your concerns.

Aw, best wishes for your cat. Mine is a demon (my own fault for naming him Shiva in the first place >___>), but I'd feel awfully bad if anything happened to him. So I know how you feel.

~Syn
Should have named him Ifrit, I guess. ;-)
comments.subject: Him?

comments.article:
Awww... I know how you feel. I got my Tiger (pictured in my userpic) as a rescue when someone beat him and threw him out to die. He collapsed on my front porch. The first three days were hell because we didn't know if he was going to make it and that was the earliest the vet could take us in. But, he made it and we're so glad he did.

Give Gus a cuddle from me. I'll be thinking of him and Tiger will be sending some of his strength.

<3
Give your cat a hug from me, too. That's a wonderful story in that you were kind enough to take him in and help him survive. He's truly a lucky cat to have fallen in with you.
Sending good thoughts to you and Parris for your four footed friend.

Best wishes to Gus.

What kind of cat is he?
Our Maltese dog just had pancreatitus(sp?) and very nearly died.  Pets become such a member of the family, hope yours recovers.

comments.subject: Re: Gus is a Maine Coon
Re: Gus is a Maine Coon
Re: Gus is a Maine Coon

comments.article: Good thoughts and best wishes concerning your pet. Hope all goes well.

comments.upictitle: Paul Wickham: Knight in shining armour
comments.article: Its hard to know what to say, I know what Gus means to you both. I send my best wishes to you all.
Very sorry to hear about Augustus. I know how difficult that can be, especially after sharing so many years with him. I hope he feels better soon.
Plenty good thoughts to Augustus. He will be fine!

I hope it's not something he got into. I hope the fellow gets better and back to mystifying his surrogate parents.

BTW, once the Chargers have dealt with New England they're gonna be looking for an Eli to play with. :)

Best of luck with, Gus.

I feel very bad for threatening to put his head on a spike, please apologise to him for me :(
I truly hope your cat is all right. As a fellow cat lover and owner of far too many of the furballs, I understand how important they are in our lives.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: ethelclose
comments.article: Much love to you, Parris, and lots of love and health to Gus.
More good wishes to Gus.  I hope the test results bring back good news, or at least something that can be addressed.

I truly hope and pray that you Parris & Shadow don't have to go through what we went through.

All of our cats are rescues whether they be from shelters or strays direct off the street. Jeffery, one of our two house patriarchs, had some issues with one of the strays we had brought in. Before we even had time to take the newbie to the vet to have him checked, they got into a bad scuffle. When the vet told us that the new cat had feline aids we were devastated. Jeffery lasted more than a year longer than the vet predicted. We had a black cat, Michael, that Jeffery reared from a kitten.(yes all our animals get regular human names) Mikey considered Jeffie his daddy cat. After we finally had to put Jeffery down, Michael cried looking for his papa every night for almost a year. He has since gotten over it but that was a very traumatic time for us.
comments.subject: Gus Gus

comments.article: The wife and I lost one of our fifteen year old cats on Nov. 1. He had been sick for sometime, but it is never fun. Our thoughts are with you...
comments.subject: Re: Gus Gus

comments.article:
Congrats George.
My Steelers almost pulled it out but managed to choke it away with under 2 minutes left. :(

My thoughts go out for good news for Augustus. I lost my Gus last year. Mine was named Augustus McCat after the character from Lonesome Dove.

Its so hard when they are sick.
